methods.name: gas
methods.desc: gas is a dummy no-op call that can be used to pool-up resource references and opcode cost

methods.name: getNumValidators
methods.desc: Returns the current number of validators

args.name: mbrPayment
args.desc: payment from caller which covers mbr increase of new validator storage

args.name: owner
args.desc: The account (presumably cold-wallet) that owns the validator set

args.name: manager
args.desc: The account that manages the pool part. keys and triggers payouts.  Normally a hot-wallet as node sidecar needs the keys

args.name: nfdAppID
args.desc: Optional NFD App ID linking to information about the validator being added - where information about the validator and their pools can be found.

methods.name: addPool
methods.desc: Adds a new pool to a validator's pool set, returning the 'key' to reference the pool in the future for staking, etc.The caller must pay the cost of the validators MBR increase as well as the MBR that will be needed for the pool itself.

args.name: mbrPayment
args.desc: payment from caller which covers mbr increase of adding a new pool

args.name: validatorID
args.desc: is ID of validator to pool to (must be owner or manager)

methods.name: addStake
methods.desc: Adds stake to a validator pool.

args.name: stakedAmountPayment
args.desc: payment coming from staker to place into a pool

returns.desc: {ValidatorPoolKey}- The key of the validator pool.

methods.name: getStakedPoolsForAccount
methods.desc: Retrieves the staked pools for an account.

args.name: staker
args.desc: The account to retrieve staked pools for.@return{ValidatorPoolKey[]}- The array of staked pools for the account.

methods.name: stakeUpdatedViaRewards
methods.desc: stakeUpdatedViaRewards is called by Staking Pools to inform the validator (us) that a particular amount of totalstake has been added to the specified pool.  This is used to update the stats we have in our PoolInfo storage.The calling App ID is validated against our pool list as well.

methods.name: stakeRemoved
methods.desc: stakerRemoved is called by Staking Pools to inform the validator (us) that a particular amount of total stake has been removedfrom the specified pool.  This is used to update the stats we have in our PoolInfo storage.The calling App ID is validated against our pool list as well.

methods.name: findPoolForStaker
methods.desc: Finds the pool for a staker based on the provided validator ID, staker address, and amount to stake.First checks the stakers 'already staked list' for the validator preferring those (adding if possible) then addsto new pool if necessary.
